solution_line_template: We know that the {long_roll_length} m roll is three times bigger than the {short_roll_length} m roll because {long_roll_length} m / {short_roll_length} m = <<{long_roll_length}/{short_roll_length}={length_ratio}>>{length_ratio}
This means the {long_roll_length} m roll weighs {length_ratio} times more than the {short_roll_length} m roll: {short_roll_weight} kg * {length_ratio} = {long_roll_weight} Kg
